Key Arguments: The proposed legislation is seen as draconian and regressive, likened to Orwellian control.
There is concern over the subjective nature of defining misinformation, using the example of gender identity debates.
The legislation is viewed as a threat to free speech and the common law right to express thoughts and ideas.
The submission argues that truth is independent of human desires and should not be censored.
Historical references are used to argue that silencing opinions is harmful to society and that governments should protect basic rights.
Main Themes: Historical and philosophical references to liberty and tyranny
Notable Quotes: It is a totally preposterous proposal to censor or suppress peopleâ€™s thoughts and ideas and their common law right to express them.
The peculiar evil of silencing the expression of an opinion is that it is robbing the human race; posterity as well as the existing generation.
